title: [FEATURE] Touch events should provide key modifiers
body:
On desktop platforms, mouse clicks can have a different behavior when done with a key modifier such as CTRL, SHIFT or COMMAND and right now using SkiaSharp view it not possible to know if a mouse click has any key modifier as this information is not provided in the SKTouchEventArgs.

The SKTouchEventArgs should be extended with a new property that provide such information to the user. For example in Gtk#, ButtonPressEventArgs have an [EventButton](http://docs.go-mono.com/?link=P%3aGdk.EventButton.State) with a State property containing a [ModifierType](http://docs.go-mono.com/index.aspx?link=T%3aGdk.ModifierType)

> VS bug [#805949](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/805949)
